title: Introduction to Docker and Basic Concepts

questions.question: What is containerization?
choices: A lightweight alternative to virtual machines that packages an application with its dependencies
A type of cloud computing service
A method for encrypting data in transit
A tool for managing virtual machine clusters
questions.answer: A lightweight alternative to virtual machines that packages an application with its dependencies

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a key component of the Docker architecture?
choices: Docker Swarm
Docker daemon
Docker client
Docker registries

questions.question: What is a Docker image?
choices: A read-only template containing instructions for creating a Docker container
A running instance of a Docker image
A tool for building Docker images
A network for connecting Docker containers
questions.answer: A read-only template containing instructions for creating a Docker container

questions.question: What is the purpose of a Dockerfile?
choices: To define the steps needed to create a Docker image
To manage Docker networks
To store data used by Docker containers
To orchestrate multi-container applications
questions.answer: To define the steps needed to create a Docker image

questions.question: Which instruction in a Dockerfile sets the base image?
choices: FROM
RUN
CMD
EXPOSE

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'docker run' command?
choices: To create and start a new container from an image
To build a Docker image from a Dockerfile
To pull an image from a Docker registry
To create a new Docker network
questions.answer: To create and start a new container from an image

questions.question: Which command is used to list all running Docker containers?
choices: docker ps
docker ls
docker images
docker containers

questions.question: What happens when you run a container with the '-d' flag?
choices: The container runs in detached mode (background)
The container runs in debug mode
The container automatically restarts on failure
The container connects to the default network
questions.answer: The container runs in detached mode (background)

questions.question: Which Docker network type is used when you want to connect a container to an existing network?
choices: bridge
host
none
overlay

questions.question: What is the purpose of the '--link' flag when running a Docker container?
choices: To create a link between two containers
To specify the image to use for the container
To set environment variables in the container
To mount a volume in the container
questions.answer: To create a link between two containers
